intro: Senecio vulgaris subsp. denticulatus, commonly known as the toothed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves with finely toothed margins, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. The species is part of the Asteraceae family, known for its composite flower heads.
